about.title: About Me
about.content: I'm a passionate software and firmware developer with a knack for turning complex problems into elegant, user-friendly solutions. My journey into the world of technology began with a fascination for how things work, and it has led me to a career where I can build innovative and impactful products. I thrive on challenges and am always eager to learn new things. When I'm not coding, you can find me exploring the latest advancements in AI, tinkering with IoT devices, or enjoying a good book.

workExperience.title: Work Experience
workExperience.job1_title: software and firmware developer - tecme sa
job1_desc: Developed and maintained mission-critical firmware (IEC 62304 compliant) in C/C++ for a medical pulmonary ventilator, managing high-reliability tasks on the QNX RTOS.
Implemented real-time control logic (sensor reading, actuator control) and the critical alarm system using C++ Finite State Machines (FSMs) for various ventilation modes.

Designed, implemented, and maintained low-level C drivers for the Toradex i.MX 6 Quad Core (ARM Cortex-A9) platform, interfacing with peripherals (I2C, SPI, ADC) and participating in the board bring-up process.
Integrated the Qt/QML-based HMI with the C++ control backend, establishing the communication API for real-time data visualization and alarm propagation.
Developed and maintained a robust unit testing suite (e.g., GoogleTest/CppUnit) for C++ modules, ensuring code quality, reliability, and facilitating regression-free development.
Automated the software internationalization (i18n) pipeline by developing Python scripts that consumed AI-based translation APIs for UI strings.
Developed code-generation (scaffolding) tools in C++ and Python to auto-generate system parameters and boilerplate code, ensuring consistency with the MVVM (Model-View-ViewModel) architecture.
workExperience.job2_date: RUF Functional Utility Robotics | May 2021 - Jun 2022
workExperience.job2_subtitle: Smart plug for remote security monitoring through cameras
job2_desc: I established communication between companies and international technicians to streamline the development and research of the microcontroller, I designed a solid structure for programming and recording on each microcontroller (ESP12 ESP32 ESP8266 and RTL) using C and C++ language, Web Design, the SDK and RTOS of the company Espressif, obtaining successful results in time and error correction in testing.
I achieved efficiency creating technical business documentation in each process, in the project I managed GitHub, GitLab and Scrum methodology.
workExperience.job3_date: UTN National Technological University | March 2021 - Dec 2023
workExperience.job3_subtitle: Research and Development - Project of current, voltage and power measurement of home electrical networks.
job3_desc: Develop an electrical measurement equipment with remote communication and sending data in real time, using embedded systems tools such as ESP, power, current and voltage sensors. The product achieved optimization, efficiency and energy control.

project2.title: IoT Smart Plug
project2.description: Designed and developed the firmware for a smart plug with remote security monitoring capabilities. This project included working with ESP32 and ESP8266 microcontrollers, and implementing communication protocols for remote control and data acquisition.

project3.title: Remote Power Monitoring System
project3.description: Developed a system for remote measurement of current, voltage, and power in home electrical networks. This project involved using embedded systems tools, power sensors, and real-time data transmission for energy optimization.

project4.title: IoT Data Acquisition Platform
project4.description: Designed and built a scalable IoT platform for collecting and visualizing data from various sensors. This project included developing a web-based dashboard for real-time data monitoring and analysis.

project5.title: AI-Powered Bird Feeder
project5.description: Transformed a bird feeder into a smart device that identifies bird species in real-time using a camera and AI on an ESP32-S3. It logs visits, displays statistics on a web dashboard, and sends notifications.

project6.title: Interactive Weather Station
project6.description: Developed an ESP32-S3 weather station with a color touchscreen. It displays weather from APIs and local air quality data (PM2.5, CO2, VOCs) with a fluid and attractive UI.

project7.title: Smart Agriculture with Precision Irrigation
project7.description: Implemented an IoT agriculture system using a wireless sensor network (ESP-NOW) to monitor and automate precision irrigation. It sends data to the cloud for remote monitoring and zone control.
